\newcommand{\ubytes}{\mathbf{U_N}}
\newcommand{\xor}{\mathbf{\,\oplus\,}}
\newcommand{\hmass}{\mathbf{\mu}}
\newcommand{\hdens}{\mathbf{\rho}}

# Defining a measure between bitsets

Let the **Hamming-mass $\hmass$ of a byte $u$** denote its number of set bits.

$$
\hmass(u) := \text{Number of set bits in }u \,\, \forall u \in \ubytes 
$$

Further extend this notion to let the **Hamming-mass of a byteset** be the total number of set bits over the whole set.

$$
\hmass(U) := \sum \limits_{u \in U} \hmass(u)
$$

Let the **Hamming-density of a byteset** be the average number of set bits.

$$
\hdens(U) := \frac{1}{\|U\|} \cdot \hmass(U) \,\,\forall\,\, \{\} \neq U \subseteq \ubytes
$$

Let the **Hamming-distance between two bytesets** be defined as the average number of bits that differ between any two members of the subsets.

$$
\text{for any } V,W \subseteq \ubytes \,\text{ let }\, H(V, W) := \frac{1}{\|V \times W \|} \sum \limits_{v \in V, w \in W} H(v, w) = \frac{1}{\|V\| \cdot \|W\|} \sum \limits_{v \in V, w \in W} H(v \xor w)
$$
